root.message: The SOURCE_TYPE field for indicator 2-2-1, translated into en
root.data: For the majority of countries, nationally representative household surveys constitute the primary data source used to generate the JME modelled estimates. For a limited number of countries, data from surveillance systems are also used as a primary data source for generation of the JME modelled estimates if sufficient population coverage is documented (about 80%). For both types of primary data sources, the child’s height/length and date of birth as well as date of measurement (to generate age in days) have to be collected following recommended standard measuring techniques (WHO/UNICEF 2019).
